title: JAX Outdoor Gear: Your Complete Guide to Colorado's Premier Family-Owned Adventure Store
description: Comprehensive guide to JAX Outdoor Gear - family-owned since 1955, offering premium camping, hiking, and outdoor equipment across Colorado and Iowa locations. Expert reviews, gear recommendations, and insider tips.

    .genspark-badge-button {
      position: fixed;
      bottom: 20px;
      right: 20px;
      background-color: #333;
      color: white;
      border: none;
      border-radius: 4px;
      padding: 8px 12px;
      font-size: 12px;
      cursor: pointer;
      z-index: 9999;
      display: flex;
      align-items: center;
      gap: 6px;
    }
    
    .genspark-modal {
      display: none;
      position: fixed;
      bottom: 80px;
      right: 20px;
      z-index: 10000;
      justify-content: end;
    }
    
    .genspark-modal-content {
      background-color: white;
      border-radius: 8px;
      max-width: 450px;
      width: 100%;
      box-sizing: border-box;
      padding: 20px;
      position: relative;
      box-shadow: 0 4px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
      font-size: 14px;
    }
    @media (max-width: 768px) {
      .genspark-modal-content {
        max-width: 90%;

    }
    
    .genspark-close {
      position: absolute;

      right: 10px;
      font-size: 20px;
      cursor: pointer;
      background: none;
      border: none;
    }
    
    .genspark-title {
      margin-bottom: 8px;
      font-weight: normal;

    }
    
    .genspark-report {

      text-decoration: underline;

      display: inline;
    }
    
    .genspark-info {
      margin: 25px 0;
      color: #333;
      font-size: 14px;
    }
    
    .genspark-buttons {
      display: flex;
      gap: 10px;
    }
    
    .genspark-remove-btn {
      background-color: #f5f5f5;
      border: 1px solid #ddd;
      color: #333;
      padding: 4px 14px;
      border-radius: 8px;
      cursor: pointer;
      flex: 1;
      font-size: 14px;
      box-sizing: border-box;
    }
    
    .genspark-go-btn {
      background-color: #222;
      border: none;
      color: white;
      padding: 4px 14px;
      border-radius: 8px;
      cursor: pointer;
      flex: 1;
      font-size: 14px;
      box-sizing: border-box;
    }
  </style><style>
    .genspark-notice-dialog {
      display: flex;
      position: fixed;
      top: 0;

      width: 100%;
      height: 100%;

      z-index: 10001;
      align-items: center;
      justify-content: center;
    }

      color: #000;

      font-family: Arial;
      font-size: 14px;

      line-height: 150%;

    }

      text-decoration: underline;
    }

    .genspark-notice-checkbox {

    }

    }

      text-align: center;

      font-style: normal;
      font-weight: 700;

      cursor: pointer;
      display: flex;
      height: 40px;
      padding: 6px 14px;
      justify-content: center;
      align-items: center;
      gap: 10px;
      align-self: stretch;
      border-radius: 8px;
      border: 1px solid #000;
      box-sizing: border-box;
      width: 100%;

body:
JAX Outdoor Gear: Your Complete Guide to Colorado's Premier Family-Owned Adventure Store

For over 70 years, JAX outdoor gear has been the trusted companion for adventurers across Colorado and Iowa. From humble beginnings as Ames Surplus in 1955 to becoming a premier destination for outdoor enthusiasts, JAX continues to embody the spirit of family-owned excellence. Whether you're planning your first camping trip or gearing up for a challenging backcountry expedition, this comprehensive guide will help you navigate everything JAX has to offer. Discover more outdoor adventures at Explore National Parks Store.

Table of Contents

  • → The JAX Story: 70 Years of Outdoor Excellence
  • → Store Locations and What Makes Each Special
  • → Essential Gear Categories and Top Picks
  • → My Experience Shopping at JAX
  • → Seasonal Shopping Guide and Expert Tips
  • → JAX vs Competitors: Honest Pros and Cons
  • → Frequently Asked Questions
  • → Conclusion

The JAX Story: 70 Years of Outdoor Excellence

The story of JAX outdoor gear begins in 1955 when Marvin and Lola Quinlan opened Ames Surplus in their home state of Iowa. What started as a small operation selling government surplus items from their home has evolved into one of the most trusted names in outdoor retail across the Midwest and Mountain West. The Quinlan family's vision was simple yet powerful: provide quality outdoor equipment with exceptional customer service that treats every customer like family.

Under the leadership of Jim Quinlan, Marvin and Lola's son, the business expanded significantly throughout the 1980s and 1990s. The first Colorado location opened in Fort Collins, recognizing the growing outdoor recreation market along the Front Range. This strategic expansion allowed JAX outdoor gear to tap into Colorado's booming outdoor culture while maintaining its Midwest roots and values.

In 2022, JAX made a significant transition by becoming an employee-owned company, ensuring that the culture of customer service and community involvement that defined the Quinlan family's approach would continue for generations. This employee ownership model has strengthened JAX's commitment to both customers and local communities, with staff members who are genuinely passionate about the outdoors and invested in the company's success.

JAX Fort Collins location - where Colorado outdoor adventures begin

Recent Update: The historic Ames, Iowa location closed in August 2025 after 70 years of serving the community, marking the end of an era while the Colorado locations continue to thrive and expand their offerings.

Store Locations and What Makes Each Special

Fort Collins - The Original Colorado Store

Address: 1200 N College Ave, Fort Collins, CO 80524

The flagship Colorado location offers the largest selection of outdoor gear and serves as the regional hub for technical equipment. This store features an extensive camping section, comprehensive fishing department, and knowledgeable staff who are active in the local outdoor community. The Fort Collins location is particularly known for its excellent boot fitting service and seasonal gear demonstrations.

Best for: Technical gear, boot fitting, and expert advice on backcountry equipment

Loveland - Family Adventure Central

Address: 1432 W Eisenhower Blvd, Loveland, CO 80537

The Loveland store excels in family-oriented outdoor gear and recreational equipment. With easy access to Boyd Lake State Park and proximity to Rocky Mountain National Park, this location specializes in family camping gear, water sports equipment, and hiking gear suitable for all ages. The staff here are particularly experienced with family outdoor adventures and can provide excellent advice for introducing kids to the outdoors.

Best for: Family camping gear, water sports, and beginner-friendly equipment

Lafayette - The Local's Choice

Address: 900 S Highway 287, Lafayette, CO 80026

Positioned perfectly between Boulder and Denver, the Lafayette location serves as a convenient stop for urban outdoor enthusiasts. This store has developed a reputation for excellent customer service and competitive pricing on quality outdoor gear. The Lafayette team is known for their personalized recommendations and ability to help customers find exactly what they need for Front Range adventures.

Best for: Front Range hiking, urban outdoor enthusiasts, and competitive pricing

Broomfield - The Complete Outfitter

Address: 5005 W 120th Ave, Broomfield, CO 80020

The newest and largest location, Broomfield combines the best of JAX's outdoor gear expertise with expanded farm and ranch supplies. This location features the most comprehensive selection of adventure gear, seasonal items, and unique products you won't find at typical outdoor retailers. The spacious layout allows for extensive product displays and seasonal demonstrations.

Best for: Largest selection, farm & ranch supplies, and unique outdoor products

Experience the JAX difference - "We are hiking, climbing, fishing, paddling, camping, and so much more"

Essential Gear Categories and Top Picks

After years of shopping at JAX outdoor gear locations, I've discovered that their strength lies not just in variety, but in their careful curation of products that actually perform in the field. Here's my breakdown of their key categories and standout recommendations:

Camping and Backpacking Equipment

JAX outdoor gear excels in camping equipment, offering everything from budget-friendly car camping setups to ultralight backpacking systems. Their camping department features trusted brands like YETI, Coleman, and specialized manufacturers that prioritize durability and performance. I've personally purchased several items from their camping section and have been consistently impressed with both product quality and staff knowledge.

The store's seasonal approach to camping gear is particularly impressive. During spring, they focus on gear sales and new arrivals, while summer brings comprehensive demonstrations and expert fitting services. Fall and winter feature clearance pricing on summer items and preparation for cold-weather camping.

Must-Have Camping Gear at JAX:

  • YETI Coolers - industry-leading ice retention
  • Quality sleeping bags for Colorado's variable weather
  • Portable camp stoves and cooking systems
  • Weather-resistant tents from reputable manufacturers

Inside JAX Broomfield - extensive outdoor gear displays

Top Amazon Pick: Camping Stove

Fire-Maple Fixed Star 1 - Reliable backpacking stove system perfect for Colorado adventures.

View on Amazon

Essential: Sleeping Pad

Ultralight camping mat with built-in pillow and foot pump - perfect for backpacking.

View on Amazon

Hiking and Trail Equipment

The hiking section at JAX outdoor gear reflects Colorado's diverse trail conditions, from easy Front Range walks to challenging fourteener ascents. Their selection emphasizes versatility and durability, with particular strength in footwear fitting and weather protection. Staff members are active hikers themselves and provide invaluable local knowledge about gear performance in specific conditions.

Water Filtration Essential

LifeStraw Personal Water Filter - lightweight, reliable, and perfect for Colorado's mountain streams.

View on Amazon

Hammock Camping

Wise Owl Outfitters Hammock with tree straps - excellent for Colorado's abundant aspen groves.

View on Amazon

Trail Hygiene

Combat Wipes ACTIVE - biodegradable outdoor wipes perfect for multi-day adventures.

View on Amazon

My Experience Shopping at JAX

My relationship with JAX outdoor gear began five years ago when I moved to Colorado and needed to upgrade from basic camping equipment to gear that could handle the state's challenging conditions. Walking into the Fort Collins location for the first time, I was immediately struck by the welcoming atmosphere and the obvious expertise of the staff.

The first employee I spoke with, Marina, spent over an hour helping me understand the differences between various sleeping bag ratings and how Colorado's elevation affects warmth requirements. This wasn't a quick sales pitch – it was genuine education from someone who clearly spent time outdoors herself. That level of service has remained consistent across all my visits to different JAX outdoor gear locations.

What sets JAX apart is their staff's real-world experience. When I was preparing for my first fourteener attempt, the Lafayette store manager, Chris, shared specific advice about layering systems based on his own recent climbs. This personal insight proved invaluable when I encountered unexpected weather on Mount Elbert. The winter gear recommendations from JAX staff have never let me down.

Over the years, I've purchased everything from day packs to technical mountaineering equipment at JAX, and their return policy has been tested several times. When a tent pole broke during a windstorm at Rocky Mountain National Park, JAX replaced it immediately without question. When I outgrew a pack after losing weight, they offered a fair trade-in credit toward a new one. This customer service extends beyond the initial purchase.

"The thing about JAX is that they're not trying to sell you the most expensive item – they're trying to sell you the right item for your specific needs and experience level. That approach has saved me hundreds of dollars and countless frustrations in the field."

Customer Reviews from the Community

Amazon Customer Review

"JAX reminds me a lot of REI, but with better customer service and more competitive prices. Their staff actually uses the gear they sell, which makes a huge difference when you're asking for advice. I've been shopping there for camping equipment for three years now."

- Verified Purchase, Fort Collins location

Reddit r/Denver

"Unique store which has a large variety of nice items. Nice clothing for both casual wear and outdoor wear. Also good hardware and yard work section. The shoe prices were amazing compared to other places. Very happy with the whole experience."

- u/ColoradoHiker, Broomfield visit

Yelp Review

"This has been a great store for camping goods, paint, quality clothing, excellent shoe/boot choices, and watches for me and my family. The staff knowledge about outdoor activities and gear selection is outstanding. Family-owned businesses like this are what make communities special."

- Verified Yelp User, Multiple locations

Seasonal Shopping Guide and Expert Tips

Shopping at JAX outdoor gear effectively requires understanding Colorado's seasonal patterns and how they affect both gear availability and pricing. Having shopped through multiple seasons, I've learned the optimal timing for different purchases and how to take advantage of JAX's seasonal promotions.

Spring (March-May)

Best for: Hiking boots, day packs, and lightweight camping gear as Colorado emerges from winter.

  • New season gear arrivals
  • Winter clearance sales
  • Boot fitting consultations
  • Running gear for trail season

Pro tip: Spring is ideal for purchasing summer camping gear before peak season pricing kicks in.

Summer (June-August)

Best for: Peak selection of camping equipment, hydration systems, and men's outdoor gear.

  • Full inventory availability
  • Gear demonstrations and events
  • Staff expertise at its peak
  • Family camping equipment focus

Pro tip: Mid-July offers the best staff availability for detailed consultations during slower weekdays.

Fall (September-November)

Best for: Hunting gear, layering systems, and end-of-season camping deals.

  • Summer gear clearance sales
  • Hunting equipment focus
  • Cold weather preparation
  • Excellent deals on seasonal items

Pro tip: Late September offers the best prices on summer camping gear as inventory clears.

Winter (December-February)

Best for: Ski gear, insulated clothing, and planning next year's adventures.

  • Winter sports equipment
  • Cold weather clothing
  • Gift cards and holiday items
  • Planning consultations

Pro tip: January clearance offers excellent deals on brand name winter gear.

Insider Shopping Tips

  • Visit during weekday mornings for the most personalized attention
  • Ask about upcoming sales - staff often know about promotions before they're advertised
  • Join their email list for exclusive member pricing on select items
  • Bring your old gear for trade-in consideration on certain items
  • Don't hesitate to ask for gear recommendations based on specific Colorado locations

JAX vs Competitors: Honest Pros and Cons

After years of shopping at various outdoor retailers, I can provide an honest comparison of JAX outdoor gear against major competitors like REI, Dick's Sporting Goods, and online retailers. This assessment is based on my direct experience across multiple categories.

JAX Advantages

Personalized Service

Staff expertise is genuinely superior to most competitors. They take time for detailed consultations and offer local knowledge that online retailers can't match.

Competitive Pricing

Often matches or beats REI prices, with frequent sales that make quality gear accessible. Legacy gear selections offer excellent value.

Local Business Support

Employee-owned model ensures profits stay in local communities, with genuine investment in customer relationships.

Product Curation

Carefully selected inventory focuses on proven performers rather than trendy but untested items.

Return Policy

Flexible returns based on relationship and reasonable use, without the bureaucracy of larger retailers.

Areas for Improvement

Limited Selection

Smaller inventory compared to REI or online retailers. May not carry niche items or the latest releases immediately.

Store Hours

Limited evening and Sunday hours can be inconvenient for working professionals compared to larger chains.

Online Presence

Website inventory and online shopping experience lag behind specialized e-commerce retailers.

Brand Variety

May not carry every major outdoor brand, particularly newer or more specialized manufacturers.

Location Limitations

Colorado-focused means limited accessibility for customers outside the Front Range corridor.

The Bottom Line Comparison

JAX outdoor gear excels when you value expert advice, fair pricing, and supporting local business over having access to every possible product option. For Colorado residents who prioritize service quality and building relationships with knowledgeable staff, JAX offers advantages that larger retailers struggle to match.

However, if you need immediate access to the latest gear releases, extensive product variety, or prefer online shopping convenience, larger retailers or specialized e-commerce sites might better serve your needs. The choice often comes down to whether you value the JAX outdoor gear experience enough to accept some limitations in selection and convenience.

Visit JAX Outdoor Gear

Frequently Asked Questions

What makes JAX outdoor gear different from REI or other outdoor retailers?

JAX outdoor gear differentiates itself through personalized service from staff with genuine outdoor experience and local knowledge. As an employee-owned company, JAX prioritizes long-term customer relationships over transaction volume. Their Colorado locations offer specific expertise about regional conditions and gear performance. While REI has broader selection and membership programs, JAX provides more intimate service with competitive pricing and flexible return policies. The staff-to-customer ratio allows for detailed consultations that larger retailers often can't provide, particularly valuable for complex purchases like basecamp gear or technical equipment.

Does JAX outdoor gear offer price matching or special discounts?

JAX offers competitive pricing and frequently runs seasonal sales, though they don't advertise a formal price matching policy. Their approach focuses on fair everyday pricing rather than artificial markup followed by discounts. Staff can often work with customers on pricing, especially for multiple item purchases or returning customers. They offer email subscriber exclusive deals and end-of-season clearances that provide substantial savings. Employee-owners have more flexibility in pricing decisions compared to corporate chains. For the best deals, visit during spring and fall clearance periods, or ask staff about upcoming promotions when making larger purchases.

What should I expect from the gear fitting and consultation services at JAX?

JAX excels in personal fitting services, particularly for boots, packs, and technical equipment. Expect staff to ask detailed questions about your intended use, experience level, and specific conditions you'll encounter. Boot fitting includes measuring both feet, discussing sock preferences, and often trying multiple brands and sizes. Pack fitting involves loading the pack with weight and adjusting for your torso length and hiking style. Staff share personal experience with products and honest assessments of suitability. Allow extra time for consultations - rushing defeats the purpose of JAX outdoor gear's personalized approach. The best consultations happen during weekday mornings when staff availability is highest.

How does JAX's return and warranty policy work for outdoor equipment?

JAX operates on a relationship-based return policy that considers reasonable use and customer history rather than rigid corporate guidelines. Most unused items can be returned within 30 days with receipt, while items showing normal wear after reasonable trial periods are evaluated individually. They work directly with manufacturers for warranty claims and often expedite replacements for loyal customers. Staff document equipment performance issues to improve future recommendations. Unlike some retailers, JAX doesn't penalize customers for actually using gear outdoors. They understand that outdoor gear needs field testing to determine suitability. Building a relationship through multiple visits improves flexibility in return situations.

Which JAX location should I visit for specific types of outdoor gear?

Each JAX outdoor gear location has developed specialties based on their customer base and local activities. Fort Collins offers the largest selection and best technical expertise for serious mountaineering and backcountry equipment. Loveland excels in family camping gear and recreational equipment suitable for Front Range activities. Lafayette provides convenient access for urban outdoor enthusiasts with strong selections in day hiking and fitness-oriented gear. Broomfield combines the largest overall inventory with unique items and farm/ranch supplies. For specialized fittings or technical consultations, Fort Collins is your best bet. For family-oriented purchases or general outdoor needs, any location provides excellent service with their core product lines.

What are the best times of year to shop at JAX for deals and selection?

Spring offers new arrivals and winter clearance sales, making it ideal for purchasing summer gear before peak season. Summer provides full inventory and peak staff expertise, perfect for complex consultations and technical equipment purchases. Fall delivers the best deals with end-of-season clearances on camping and hiking equipment. Winter focuses on cold weather gear and planning for next year's adventures. The sweet spot for both selection and pricing is late May through early June, when new seasonal inventory arrives but summer premium pricing hasn't started. Black Friday and end-of-January clearances provide the deepest discounts. For the best personal attention, shop weekday mornings when staff can provide detailed consultations without rush.

Conclusion

After exploring the world of JAX outdoor gear through multiple seasons and countless adventures, it's clear that this family-owned retailer offers something increasingly rare in today's outdoor industry: genuine expertise paired with personal service. From their humble beginnings as Ames Surplus in 1955 to their current status as Colorado's premier destination for outdoor enthusiasts, JAX has maintained its commitment to outfitting adventurers with gear that actually works in real-world conditions.

The transition to employee ownership has only strengthened their community focus, ensuring that the values Marvin and Lola Quinlan established seven decades ago continue to guide every customer interaction. Whether you're gearing up for your first camping trip or preparing for a technical alpine ascent, JAX outdoor gear provides the expertise and equipment selection needed for Colorado's diverse outdoor opportunities.

While larger retailers may offer broader selection and online convenience, JAX delivers irreplaceable value through staff knowledge, fair pricing, and genuine investment in customer success. Their Colorado locations serve as more than retail stores – they're community hubs where outdoor experience is shared, gear performance is honestly assessed, and adventurers receive the guidance needed to pursue their passions safely and confidently.

For those who value quality over quantity and relationships over transactions, JAX outdoor gear represents outdoor retail at its finest. As you plan your next adventure, consider visiting a JAX location to experience firsthand why generations of outdoor enthusiasts have trusted their expertise and selection.

Back to Top Explore More Adventures
